member.name: T:Yggdrasil.Logging.Logger
member.summary: Logging class with support for codes that are passed down to the log targets.
member.remarks:
Codes have the format "^[a-z]+[0-9]*;", with targets getting the raw message passed to the logger, incl. codes, and a clean one, without them. It's up to the loggers to decide what to do with them, and there's no rules as to what codes there can be, or what the target will do with them.
For example, the ConsoleTarget will recognize c[0-9]*, b[0-9]*, and r, for color, background color, and resetting the colors respectively.

member.name: T:Yggdrasil.Scheduling.Heartbeat
member.summary: A world's heartbeat, running a continues loop that other components can utilize.
member.remarks: The Scheduler and the Heartbeat class can technically be used for the same purposes, but the Scheduler is a precisely timed loop that aims to execute callbacks at the exact moments they were scheduled for, while the Heartbeat ticks in continues, but less precise, intervals. It also being more resource friendly makes it the better candidate for regularly occurring events, such as raising time events.

member.name: T:Yggdrasil.Security.Hashing.BCrypt
member.summary: BCrypt implements OpenBSD-style Blowfish password hashing using the scheme described in "A Future-Adaptable Password Scheme" by Niels Provos and David Mazieres.

remarks.para: This password hashing system tries to thwart offline password cracking using a computationally-intensive hashing algorithm, based on Bruce Schneier's Blowfish cipher. The work factor of the algorithm is parametized, so it can be increased as computers get faster.
To hash a password for the first time, call the HashPassword method with a random salt, like this:
To check whether a plaintext password matches one that has been hashed previously, use the CheckPassword method:
The GenerateSalt method takes an optional parameter (logRounds) that determines the computational complexity of the hashing:
remarks.code: string strongSalt = BCrypt.GenerateSalt(10); string strongerSalt = BCrypt.GenerateSalt(12);
remarks.para: The amount of work increases exponentially (2**log_rounds), so each increment is twice as much work. The default log_rounds is 10, and the valid range is 4 to 31.

member.summary: Encode a byte array using bcrypt's slightly-modified Base64 encoding scheme. Note that this is _not_ compatible with the standard MIME-Base64 encoding.
member.param: The number of bytes to encode

member.summary: Decode a string encoded using BCrypt's Base64 scheme to a byte array. Note that this is _not_ compatible with the standard MIME-Base64 encoding.
member.param: The maximum number of bytes to decode
member.returns: An array containing the decoded bytes

member.name: T:Yggdrasil.IO.FileReader
member.summary: General use class to read files line for line.
member.remarks:
Ignores empty lines and lines prefixed with '!', ';', '#', '//', or '--'. Supports including of files via 'include {file}' and 'require {file}'. Require raises an exception if the file couldn't be found.
Paths to included files may not be absolute. If a path starts with a slash, the path is relative to the working directory. This simplifies including files from other sub-folders of the application.
